title: How to Program an RCA Universal Remote Without a "Code Search" Button

steps.title: Find your remote control's revision number.
steps.content: Find your remote control's revision number. You'll usually find this model number, which is comprised of a mix of numbers and letters, on the back of the remote (e.g., on the battery cover).

steps.title: Make sure you know which brand your remote is.
steps.content: Make sure you know which brand your remote is. You can normally find the brand name on the top of the remote, but you may have to look for the brand name on the battery cover as well.

steps.title: Open the RCA Remote Code Finder page.
steps.content: Open the RCA Remote Code Finder page. Go to https://www.rcaaccessories.com/remote-code-finder/ in your computer's web browser.

steps.title: Click the "Revision Number" drop-down box.
steps.content: Click the "Revision Number" drop-down box. It's on the left side of the page. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Select your remote control's revision number.
steps.content: Select your remote control's revision number. Find in the drop-down menu the number that matches the code you found on your remote, then click the number to select it. You can skip down to the correct number by typing in the first couple of characters once the drop-down menu is open.

steps.title: Click the "Device Brand Name" drop-down box.
steps.content: Click the "Device Brand Name" drop-down box. This is the middle drop-down box. Clicking it prompts a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select your remote control's brand.
steps.content: Select your remote control's brand. Click in the drop-down menu the brand name you found for your remote.

steps.title: Click the "Device Type" drop-down box.
steps.content: Click the "Device Type" drop-down box. It's on the far-right side of the page. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click the item with which you want to use your remote.
steps.content: Click the item with which you want to use your remote. For example, if you're attempting to program your remote for a TV, you would click TV in the "Device Type" drop-down menu. If you don't see your item's name, you'll need to use the Code Search method instead. This applies to the Other category as well.

steps.title: Review your code.
steps.content: Review your code. You should see at least one four-digit code in the middle of the page; depending on your item, you may see two or more codes here.

steps.title: Make sure your remote's item is turned on.
steps.content: Make sure your remote's item is turned on. For example, if you're programming your remote for a TV, make sure that the TV is powered on.

steps.title: Point your remote at the item for which you want to program it.
steps.content: Point your remote at the item for which you want to program it. Doing so ensures that you won't have to worry about interference from other items when entering your code.

steps.title: Hold down the item's button.
steps.content: Hold down the item's button. The item's button will usually have the name of the item for which you want to program the remote written on or under it. For example, if you're programming your remote for the TV, you would hold down the TV button.

steps.title: Enter the code while holding down the item's button.
steps.content: Enter the code while holding down the item's button. Use the remote control's keypad to type in the four-digit code that you retrieved from the RCA Remote Code Finder website. For example, if you're programming the remote for a TV, you would hold down the TV button while typing in the four-digit code from the website.

steps.title: Release the item's button.
steps.content: Release the item's button. Doing so enters the code.

steps.title: Look for the confirmation flash.
steps.content: Look for the confirmation flash. If the programming was successful, you'll see the remote control's LED light flash one time. If you see four flashes instead, your remote encountered an error. Try a different code if the website listed more than one possible code for your item.

steps.title: Try using Code Search mode
steps.content: Try using Code Search mode . Even though your remote control doesn't have a Code Search button, you can enable code searching for any RCA remote. You'll need to do this if you were unable to program your remote for your selected item by entering the code(s) that you found on the RCA Remote Code Finder page.

steps.title: Make sure your remote's item is turned on.
steps.content: Make sure your remote's item is turned on. For example, if you're programming your remote for a TV, make sure that the TV is powered on.

steps.title: Select between a VCR and a DVD player if necessary.
steps.content: Select between a VCR and a DVD player if necessary. If you're attempting to program your remote for a VCR or a DVD player, do the following: [1] X Research source Hold down the VCR/DVD button on the remote. While holding the VCR/DVD button, press 2 for a VCR or 3 for a DVD player. Release both buttons and wait for your remote control's LED light to stop flashing.

steps.title: Enable the Code Search feature.
steps.content: Enable the Code Search feature. Hold down the Power button along with the button for the item for which you want to program your remote.

steps.title: Release both buttons when prompted.
steps.content: Release both buttons when prompted. When your remote control's LED light turns on and stays on, you can release the item's button and the Power button.

steps.title: Point your remote at the item for which you want to program it.
steps.content: Point your remote at the item for which you want to program it. This will ensure that the remote enters the codes correctly.

steps.title: Press the "Play" button.
steps.content: Press the "Play" button. Doing so will cause the remote to enter a batch of 10 separate codes into the item for which you're programming it.

steps.title: Wait for the LED light to stop flashing.
steps.content: Wait for the LED light to stop flashing. Once the LED light stop's flashing, you can proceed. If your item turns off, skip the next step.

steps.title: Repeat pressing the "Play" button until your item turns off.
steps.content: Repeat pressing the "Play" button until your item turns off. Each time you press "Play", wait for the LED light to stop flashing and then check the item; if the item turns off, continue to the next step.

steps.title: Press the "Reverse" button.
steps.content: Press the "Reverse" button. It's the "Rewind" arrow on your remote. This will cause the item to check the last-sent code.

steps.title: Wait for at least two seconds, then check to see if the item turned back on.
steps.content: Wait for at least two seconds, then check to see if the item turned back on. If it did turn back on, you can skip the next step.

steps.title: Repeat pressing the "Reverse" button until the item turns back on.
steps.content: Repeat pressing the "Reverse" button until the item turns back on. Make sure you're waiting for at least two seconds between pressing the "Reverse" button and checking the item. Once the item turns back on, you can proceed.

steps.title: Exit Code Search mode.
steps.content: Exit Code Search mode. Hold down the "Stop" button until the remote control's light turns off. You have successfully programmed your RCA remote for your selected item.
